subject: Philosophy
title: Stoics and Emotions
description: A fast breakdown of Stoics and Emotions for builders.

hook.text: People think Stoics suppress emotions. That's a myth. They trained them.

buildup.text: Stoics distinguished between passions (irrational reactions) and good emotions grounded in reason.

discovery.text: Joy, goodwill, and appropriate caution are Stoic-approved emotions. They're rational responses.

twist.text: What Stoics rejected was being enslaved by emotions ‚Äî rage, panic, jealousy controlling your actions.

climax.text: The goal isn't to feel nothing. It's to feel the right things for the right reasons.

punchline.text: Stoics don't kill emotions. They master them.

quiz.question: What did Stoics actually believe about emotions?
options: Some emotions are rational and worth cultivating
